thread.title: Ethics Office Says Disciplinary Action Is Warranted Against Conway For Ivanka Comment
thread.title_full: Ethics Office Says Disciplinary Action Is Warranted Against Conway For Ivanka Comment

author: Jack Davis
title: Ethics Office Says Disciplinary Action Is Warranted Against Conway For Ivanka Comment

organizations.name: ethics office says disciplinary action is warranted against conway for ivanka comment ethics office says disciplinary action is warranted against conway for ivanka comment

text:
Ethics Office Says Disciplinary Action Is Warranted Against Conway For Ivanka Comment "... there is strong reason to believe ..." by Jack Davis February 14, 2017 at 1:03pm Share on Facebook Share Tweet Email Email Print Advertisement - story continues below 
White House counselor Kellyanne Conway’s defiant dare to consumers to go buy Ivanka Trump’s line of clothing and accessories has been condemned by a government ethics office. 
“I recommend that the White House investigate Ms. Conway’s actions and consider taking disciplinary action against her,” Office of Government Ethics director Walter Shaub wrote in a Feb. 13 letter. 
“Under the present circumstances, there is strong reason to believe that Ms. Conway has violated the Standards of Conduct Act and that disciplinary action is warranted,” he added in the letter to White House legal counsel Stefan Passantino. Advertisement - story continues below 
The letter was posted online by Democrats on the House Oversight Committee. Government’s ethics watchdog recommends that the White House investigate and possibly discipline Kellyanne Conway https://t.co/X20R2aT7B7 pic.twitter.com/PAe3rycEni 
— The Boston Globe (@BostonGlobe) February 14, 2017 
Conway spoke up Thursday after Nordstrom decided not to stock Ivanka Trump’s clothing line, which had been the subject of protests related to her father’s election to the White House. Advertisement - story continues below 
Conway took a defiant tone. “Go buy Ivanka’s stuff, is what I would tell you,” Conway said. “I’m going to give it a free commercial here. Go buy it today.” 
The comment drew bipartisan attacks that Conway had crossed a line. 
Further, the website Politico reported that Ivanka Trump was also irked at Conway for creating a controversy to which her brand would be linked. 
In the letter sent to the White House, Shaub ruled that Conway used her interview “as an opportunity to market Ms. Trump’s products.” Advertisement - story continues below
